docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 17 -- The Argentine postoffice authorities, who are in charge of censoring or otherwise controlling radio programs, have begun what looks like a campaign to eliminate all broadcasts in Argentina that are sponsored by...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 17 -- The Argentine postoffice authorities, who are in charge of censoring or otherwise controlling radio programs, have begun what looks like a campaign to eliminate all broadcasts in Argentina that are sponsored by individuals or organizations identified with the United Nations or that contain news or comments favorable to them, according to information here today.
docs.abstract: Argentine PO authorities suppress broadcasts sponsored by individuals or organizations identified with United Nations or which contain material favorable to them

headline.main: ARGENTINA BLOCKS ALLIED RADIO NEWS; Broadcast Programs Related to United Nations Also Are Suppressed

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 18 -- The Buenos Aires police have arrested five men -- including Dr. Frederico Pinedo, former Minister of Finance -- who are presumed to be the ringleaders of a plan to stage a silent protest against the Argentine Government...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 18 -- The Buenos Aires police have arrested five men -- including Dr. Frederico Pinedo, former Minister of Finance -- who are presumed to be the ringleaders of a plan to stage a silent protest against the Argentine Government on the first anniversary of the June Fourth revolution.
docs.abstract: plan to stage silent protest against regime foiled; 5 alleged leaders, including Dr F Pinedo, held; resignations of Perlinger and Mason reptd

headline.main: ARGENTINA UPSETS PROTEST CAMPAIGN; 5 Alleged Leaders of Plan to Stage a June 7 'Sit-Down' Demonstration Arrested

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 19 -- After the arrest by the Buenos Aires police Wednesday of five men believed to be the organizers of a "civil disobedience campaign" in protest against the present military government, a wave of arrests spread over...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 19 -- After the arrest by the Buenos Aires police Wednesday of five men believed to be the organizers of a "civil disobedience campaign" in protest against the present military government, a wave of arrests spread over Argentina yesterday and today.

headline.main: WAVE OF ARRESTS SWEEPS ARGENTINA; Government Acts to Stamp Out Protest Campaign Against the Military Regime HUNDREDS KEPT IN JAILS Rumor of Split in 2 Factions of Farrell's Regime Persists -- Cabinet Is in Session

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 20 -- About 100 persons in the city of Buenos Aires and a like number in the interior of Argentina are being held in jails at the disposal of the political police for their alleged conspiracy against the military government....
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 20 -- About 100 persons in the city of Buenos Aires and a like number in the interior of Argentina are being held in jails at the disposal of the political police for their alleged conspiracy against the military government. The majority of them are workers and labor leaders.
docs.abstract: Many workers held, Buenos Aires outskirts, for pol activity

headline.main: ARGENTINA BLOCKS 2 PROTEST GROUPS; 200 Leaders of Anti-Regime Bodies Still Kept in Jails -- Most Are Workmen

docs.lead_paragraph: AN airmail cover received from Stockholm last week bears as postage two unheralded stamps, 5-ore green and 60o red-violet, picturing a seventeenth century maritime map and inscribed "Sveriges Sjokarta 300 Ar" (Sweden's Marine Chart 300 Years).

docs.snippet: Volume buying of the Canadian free dollar last week lifted the value of that currency to 90.93 cents, highest since Sept. 20, 1939. The week's lowest was 90.56 cents, made on Tuesday, while Saturday's closing of 90.82 cents, represented a gain of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Volume buying of the Canadian free dollar last week lifted the value of that currency to 90.93 cents, highest since Sept. 20, 1939. The week's lowest was 90.56 cents, made on Tuesday, while Saturday's closing of 90.82 cents, represented a gain of 1/16 cent over the preceding week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MAY 20, 1944

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 22 -- An amusing illustration of how many Argentines feel about their present military Government is offered by a decree that the Federal Commissioner for the Province of Entre Rios issued yesterday. He forbade all movie...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 22 -- An amusing illustration of how many Argentines feel about their present military Government is offered by a decree that the Federal Commissioner for the Province of Entre Rios issued yesterday. He forbade all movie theatres and other places of public entertainment to exhibit newsreels showing any provincial or national official of the regime deposed by the revolution June fourth of last year.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 24 -- Orders have gone out to about 100 producers of cotton textiles instructing them to set aside specific quantities of their output of certain fabrics which are to be delivered under orders bearing preference ratings to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 24 -- Orders have gone out to about 100 producers of cotton textiles instructing them to set aside specific quantities of their output of certain fabrics which are to be delivered under orders bearing preference ratings to manufacturers of children's wearing apparel, the War Production Board announced today.
docs.abstract: WPB copper recovery inventory div to move from NYC to Washington, DC

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 25 -- A solemn Te Deum was sung in the Buenos Aires Cathedral this morning to celebrate the 134th anniversary of Argentine independence and was attended, with the exception of the Mexican Ambassador, by the whole foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 25 -- A solemn Te Deum was sung in the Buenos Aires Cathedral this morning to celebrate the 134th anniversary of Argentine independence and was attended, with the exception of the Mexican Ambassador, by the whole foreign diplomatic corps, including United States Ambassador Norman Armour, British Ambassador Sir David Victor Kelly and representatives of all the other powers that have recognized President Ellmiro Farrell as Gen. Pedro P. Ramirez's lawful successor.
docs.abstract: anniv marked, Buenos Aires; Allies participate, Buenos Aires Cath

headline.main: ALLIES PARTICIPATE IN ARGENTINE HOLIDAY; U.S. and British Rejoice With the People, Not the Regime
